==============================================================

Swiss Hard Rock act SIDEBURN, operational since the late 80s originally went under the title GENOCIDE, issuing the &#039;Roots In Rock&#039; album, recorded by ACCEPT&#039;s Dierk Steffens in Hamburg, under their former name. A second GENOCIDE album, &#039;Showtime&#039; produced by KROKUS veteran Jurg Naegeli, surfaced in 1992. Signing to major label BMG the group scored the support tour to KROKUS in 1995 promoting third album &#039;Stranded&#039;. 

The revised band title of SIDEBURN was adopted during 1997 for the &#039;Sell Your Soul To Rock n&#039; Roll&#039; album. A single, the Christoph Alispach produced &#039;Get That Way&#039;, would include three live tracks recorded in Einsideln during May of 1995. The band veered off sharply into a new musical direction of high energy Rock and pulled in Jurg Naegeli once more to produce the &#039;Crocodile&#039; album. This record included a cover version of ROSE TATTOO&#039;s &#039;Remedy&#039;. SIDEBURN returned in May 2004 with the &#039;Gasoline&#039; album, once again seeing Jurg Naegeli as producer. SIDEBURN saw changes in 2005 as guitarist David Pariat was replaced by Boris. 

The December 2006 compilation album &#039;Archives 1990 - 2006&#039; included a new recording in a cover version of CREEDANCE CLEARWATER REVIVAL&#039;s &#039;Up Around The Bend&#039;."
